1.question: After we had eaten lunch, we flew our kites. That was fantastic because we .................. the kites ourselves!
1.full_text:
After we had eaten lunch, we flew our kites. That was fantastic because we .................. the kites ourselves!

Options:
A) made
B) had made
C) were made
D) were making
1.solution:
اگر او تنها فرزند خانواده بود، ممکن بود اوضاع از خیلی جهات برای او متفاوت باشد.
توضیح: فاعل این جمله he است، پس گزینه های ۳ و ۴ که children (بچه ها) در آن ها به کار رفته است، نمی توانند درست باشند. در گزینهٔ ۱ نیز
باید قبل از only کلمهٔ an یا the به کار برود تا در جمله درست باشد. در نتیجه پاسخ درست گزینهٔ ۲ است.

2.question: The students' final degrees will indude the work and projects ........ during the yeur.
2.full_text:
The students' final degrees will indude the work and projects ........ during the yeur.

Options:
A) done then
B) which done
C) that they do
D) which they do them
2.solution:
زنان ۶۰ تا ۶۸ سال که دوندهٔ ماراتن هستند به طور متوسط هر سال دو دقیقه سریع تر می دوند.
توضیح: در این جمله دو چیز با هم مقایسه شده اند (هر سال با سال قبل از خود) در نتیجه به صفت تفضیلی نیاز داریم، پس گزینه های ۲ و ۳ حذف
می شوند. در ضمن اگر گزینهٔ ۴ را در نقطه چین قرار دهیم، جمله بی معنی می شود. پس فقط گزینهٔ ۱ درست است. (یادآوری: عبارت each year
به معنی "هر سال" است. )

3.question: If he had been ................... In the family, things right have been different for him in so many ways.
3.full_text:
If he had been ................... In the family, things right have been different for him in so many ways.

Options:
A) only child
B) the only child
C) the only children
D) an only children
3.solution:
همهٔ ما می دانیم که وقتی دو نفر با یکدیگر همکاری می کنند، به ایده های بهتری می رسند.
۱) تاسیس کردن

4.question: Women aged 60-68 running the marathon run on average two minutes .......... year.
4.full_text:
Women aged 60-68 running the marathon run on average two minutes .......... year.

Options:
A) faster each
B) the fastest
C) fastest of the
D) faster than
4.solution:
۲) بیرون دادن، ساطع کردن
۳) اندازه گیری کردن
۴) به ... رسیدن
شما می توانید از این دستگاه برای اسکن تصویر و بازتولید آن روی صفحه به شکل الکترونیکی استفاده کنید.
۱) رویداد

5.question: We all know that when two people cooperate with each other, they ........... better Ideas.
5.full_text:
We all know that when two people cooperate with each other, they ........... better Ideas.

Options:
A) found
B) give off
C) measure
D) come up with
5.solution:
۲) دشت
۳) شکل، قالب
۴) منطقه، ناحیه
اگر چیزی را می خواهید که هرگز نداشته اید، باید مایل باشید تا کاری را انجام دهید که هیچ وقت انجام نداده اید.
۱) پایدار

6.question: You can use the device to scan the image and reproduce it on-screen in an electronie .......
6.full_text:
You can use the device to scan the image and reproduce it on-screen in an electronie .......

Options:
A) event
B) plain
C) format
D) region
6.solution:
۲) مایل، مشتاق
۳) ارزشمند
در مناطق سردسیر، خانه ها باید دیوارهایی داشته باشند که گرمای خورشید را جذب می کند.
۱) جذب کردن

7.question: If you want something you've never had, you must be ................. to do something you've never done.
7.full_text:
If you want something you've never had, you must be ................. to do something you've never done.

Options:
A) stable
B) willing
C) valuable
D) probable
7.solution:
۲) ممنوع کردن
۳) بزرگ شدن
او خوش شانس بود که در خانواده ای برجسته که به خاطر مهربانی و سخاوت معروف بودند به دنیا آمد.
۱) اجتماعی

8.question: In cold regions, houses need to have walls that will ................. the heat from the sun.
8.full_text:
In cold regions, houses need to have walls that will ................. the heat from the sun.

Options:
A) absorb
B) forbid
C) grow up
D) stand for
8.solution:
۲) روان، سلیس
۳) شاد، سرخوش
۴) محتمل
۴) مخففٍِ ... بودن
۴) برجسته، متمایز
به گفتهٔ آلبر کامو، فیلسوف و نویسندهٔ فرانسوی، "یک مرد بدون اخلاق یک حیوان وحشی آزاد در این دنیا است".
۱) دستگاه

9.question: She was fortunate to have been born into ........ family known for their kindness and generosity.
9.full_text:
She was fortunate to have been born into ........ family known for their kindness and generosity.

Options:
A) social
B) fluent
C) cheerful
D) distinguished
9.solution:
۲) عادت ها
او در نوجوانی از ترس این که به او بخندند به ندرت حرفش را می زد.
۱) به ندرت

10.question: According to French philosopher and enthor Albert Camus, "A man without .................. is a wild animal free in this world".
10.full_text:
According to French philosopher and enthor Albert Camus, "A man without .................. is a wild animal free in this world".

Options:
A) device
B) habits
C) ethics
D) diversity
10.solution:
۲) به آرامی
۳) اخلاق، اصول اخلاقی
۳) به طور معمول
او وقتی دید دختر کوچکش به سمت خیابان شلوغ دوید، تا حد مرگ ترسید.
۱) صورت
۲) خون
۳) بیماری
۴) تنوع
۴) به طورقابل درک
۴) مرگ
----------
ا ترجمهٔ :Cloze Test
مغز انسان بسیار مرموز است. سوالات زیادی در مورد مغز هنوز پاسخ داده نشده اند. مثلاً ما چرا باید بخوابیم یا چرا خواب می بینیم؟ در
مورد مغز (موارد) بسیاری وجود دارد که ما نمی فهمیم. باور کنید یا نه، سابقاً مردم مغز را یک (مادهٔ) بی فایده برای پر کردن (جمجمه)
می دانستند. البته، ما می دانیم که مغز مرکز کنترل ما است. سطح مغز را قشر مغز می نامند. این (قسمت) آن بخش از مغز است که ما را باهوش
می کند و از چهار قسمت به نام لوب (lobe) تشکیل شده است. لوب جلویی جایی است که بیشتر احساس و تفکر ما اتفاق می افتد. لوب
بالایی اطلاعاتی را پردازش می کند که از قسمت هایی از بدن مان مانند پوست و ماهیچه های ما می آید. لوب کناری نقش مهمی را در شنوایی،
گفتار و حافظهٔ بلند مدت بازی می کند در حالی که لوب پشتی تصاویر به دست آمده از چشمان ما را پردازش می کند.
۸۸ - پاسخ گزینه ا
توضیح: این جمله، مجهول است و فعل آن باید شامل شکلی از to be به همراه قسمت سوم فعل اصلی باشد، بنابراین گزینه های ۲ یا ۴ نادرست
هستند. ساختارگزینهٔ ۳ نیز نادرست است زیرا not باید قبل از to be باشد.

11.question: As a teenager, she ...... spoke her mind out of fear of being laughed at.
11.full_text:
As a teenager, she ...... spoke her mind out of fear of being laughed at.

Options:
A) rarely
B) ealmly
C) normally
D) comprehensibly
11.solution: توضیح: دقت کنید که a lot یک عبارت است که همیشه به همین صورت به کار می رود، پس فقط گزینهٔ ۲ درست است.

12.question: She was frightened to .................... when she saw her small daughter ren toward the busy street.
12.full_text:
She was frightened to .................... when she saw her small daughter ren toward the busy street.

13.question:
The human brain is very mysterious. Many questions about the brain have.............. (A). For example, why do we need to sleep or why do we dream?................. (B) lot about the brain that we still do not understand. Believe it or not, people used to think of the brain as useless stuffing......... (C), we now know the brain is our control center. The surface of the brain is called the cerebral cortex. It is the part of the brain that makes us intelligent, and it consists of four parts called lobes. The front lobe is .............. (D) of our thinking and feeling happens. The top lobe processes information which is coming from parts of our bodies, such as our skin and muscles. The side lobe plays an important................. (E) in hearing, speech and long-term memories while the back lobe processes images from our eyes.
Cloze Test (A):
13.full_text:
The human brain is very mysterious. Many questions about the brain have.............. (A). For example, why do we need to sleep or why do we dream?................. (B) lot about the brain that we still do not understand. Believe it or not, people used to think of the brain as useless stuffing......... (C), we now know the brain is our control center. The surface of the brain is called the cerebral cortex. It is the part of the brain that makes us intelligent, and it consists of four parts called lobes. The front lobe is .............. (D) of our thinking and feeling happens. The top lobe processes information which is coming from parts of our bodies, such as our skin and muscles. The side lobe plays an important................. (E) in hearing, speech and long-term memories while the back lobe processes images from our eyes.
Cloze Test (A):

Options:
A) not yet been answered
B) yet not answered
C) yet to be not answered
D) not answered yet
13.solution:
۲) حیف شد
۳) صادقانه بگویم
۴) البته
توضیح: در این جمله به ضمیر موصولی نیاز داریم، در نتیجه گزینهٔ ۱ حذف می شود. از طرفی معمولاً قبل از ضمیرهای موصولی which و that یک
اسم قرار می گیرد. در این جمله قبل از نقطه چین is قرار گرفته است، پس گزینه های ۲ و ۳ نیز نمی توانند درست باشند و پاسخ درست گزینهٔ ۴ است.

14.question: Cloze Test (B):
14.full_text:
The human brain is very mysterious. Many questions about the brain have.............. (A). For example, why do we need to sleep or why do we dream?................. (B) lot about the brain that we still do not understand. Believe it or not, people used to think of the brain as useless stuffing......... (C), we now know the brain is our control center. The surface of the brain is called the cerebral cortex. It is the part of the brain that makes us intelligent, and it consists of four parts called lobes. The front lobe is .............. (D) of our thinking and feeling happens. The top lobe processes information which is coming from parts of our bodies, such as our skin and muscles. The side lobe plays an important................. (E) in hearing, speech and long-term memories while the back lobe processes images from our eyes.
Cloze Test (B):

Options:
A) They are a 
B) There is a 
C) It's a pity 
D) There are so
14.solution:
۱) نقش
ترجمهٔ درک مطلب ۱:
۲) ارزش
۳) ابزار
۴ اثر
گاهی اوقات انسان و حیوان با هم درگیر می شوند. این (امر) می تواند معیشت مردم و همچنین جان حیوانات را تهدید کند. در مرکز
نامیبیا، کشاورزان با یوزپلنگ ها مشکل دارند. یوزپلنگ ها بچهٔ گاوها (گوساله) را شکار می کنند. در عوض، کشاورزان اغلب سعی می کنند این
گربه های وحشی را بکشند تا از گله های خود محافظت کنند!
آیا خوب نمی بود اگر می توانستیم شرایط را مطالعه کنیم و راه حلی پیدا کنیم که هم برای کشاورزان و هم برای یوزپلنگ ها مناسب باشد؟
این همان کاری است که ما با تحقیقات خود انجام دادیم. ما رفتار یوزیلنگ را دنبال کردیم. ما متوجه شدیم که یوزیلنگ ها از منطقهٔ خود
برای رفتن به دنبال گوساله ها جابه جا نمی شوند. ما فکر می کردیم که اگر کشاورزان گروه های گاو خود را به همراه گوساله ها در مناطق خاصی
نگهداری کنند، و نه در مناطق دیگر، می توانند از حملات یوزپلنگ جلوگیری کنند. کشاورزان به توصیهٔ ما عمل کردند. آن ها سپس تعداد
گوساله هایی را که قبل و بعد از این تغییرات توسط یوزیلنگ ها کشته شدند مقایسه کردند. خُب، آیا توصیهٔ ما جواب داد؟ بله! کشاورزان
کاهش قابل توجهی در گوساله های کشته شده توسط یوزیلنگ مشاهده کردند. این (امر) می تواند مانع از دست دادن دام های ارزشمند
کشاورزان شود و آن ها را از تلاش برای کشتن یوزیلنگ ها باز دارد.
گشتن به دنبال راه حل های مبتنی بر رفتار حیوانات می تواند برای گونه های دیگر نیز کارساز باشد. آیا شما می توانید به یک درگیری بین
انسان و حیات وحش در منطقهٔ خود فکر کنید؟ و آیا فکر می کنید این (درگیری ها) می توانند بدون آسیب یا کشته شدن حیوانات حل شوند؟

15.question: Cloze Test (C):
15.full_text:
The human brain is very mysterious. Many questions about the brain have.............. (A). For example, why do we need to sleep or why do we dream?................. (B) lot about the brain that we still do not understand. Believe it or not, people used to think of the brain as useless stuffing......... (C), we now know the brain is our control center. The surface of the brain is called the cerebral cortex. It is the part of the brain that makes us intelligent, and it consists of four parts called lobes. The front lobe is .............. (D) of our thinking and feeling happens. The top lobe processes information which is coming from parts of our bodies, such as our skin and muscles. The side lobe plays an important................. (E) in hearing, speech and long-term memories while the back lobe processes images from our eyes.
Cloze Test (C):
Options:
A) Really 
B) It's a pity 
C) To be honest 
D) Of course
15.solution:
کلمهٔ "cattle" (گله) در پاراگراف نزدیکترین معنی را به "herd" (گله، رمه) دارد.
۱) گله

16.question: Cloze Test (D):
16.full_text:
The human brain is very mysterious. Many questions about the brain have.............. (A). For example, why do we need to sleep or why do we dream?................. (B) lot about the brain that we still do not understand. Believe it or not, people used to think of the brain as useless stuffing......... (C), we now know the brain is our control center. The surface of the brain is called the cerebral cortex. It is the part of the brain that makes us intelligent, and it consists of four parts called lobes. The front lobe is .............. (D) of our thinking and feeling happens. The top lobe processes information which is coming from parts of our bodies, such as our skin and muscles. The side lobe plays an important................. (E) in hearing, speech and long-term memories while the back lobe processes images from our eyes.
Cloze Test (D):

Options:
A) the place 
B) which 
C) that all 
D) where much
16.solution:
۲) زندگی
هدف مطالعه شرح داده شده در پاراگراف ۲ چه بود؟
۱) کشف دلیل این که چرا کشاورزان یوزیلنگ ها را کشتند
۳) مزرعه
۲) یافتن راهی برای کمک به جلوگیری از کشته شدن گوساله ها و یوزپلنگ ها
۳) درک این که چگونه باعث شویم یوزپلنگ ها منطقه ای را که در آن زندگی می کنند، تغییر دهند
۴) محصولات (کشاورزی)
۴) توضیح این که چرا هم کشاورزان و هم یوزپلنگ ها نمی توانستند یکدیگر را درک کنند و به یکدیگر احترام بگذارند

17.question:
Passage 1:Sometimes humans and animals come into conflict with each other. This can threaten people's livelihoods and also threaten the animals' lives. In central Namibia, farmers have a problem with cheetahs. The cheetahs prey on the baby cows (calves). In tum, the farmers often try to kill the wild cats in order to protect their cattle!
Wouldn't it be great if we could study the situation and find a solution that suits both the farmers and the cheetahs? This is what we did with our research. We tracked the cheetah's behavior. We noticed that the cheetahs did not move their area to go after the calves. We thought that if the farmers kept their groups of cows with calves in certain areas, and not in others, they could avoid cheetah attacks. The farmers took our advice. They then compared the number of calves killed by cheetahs before and after these changes. So, did our advice work? Yes! The farmers observed a significant reduction in calves killed by cheetahs. This could prevent farmers from losing their valuable livestock and stop them from trying to kill the cheetahs.
Looking for solutions based on animal behavior could work for other species too. Can you think of any human-wildlife conflicts in your area? And do you think they could be solved without the animals being harmed or killed?
The word "cattle" in paragraph 1 is closest in meaning to.....
17.full_text:
Passage 1:Sometimes humans and animals come into conflict with each other. This can threaten people's livelihoods and also threaten the animals' lives. In central Namibia, farmers have a problem with cheetahs. The cheetahs prey on the baby cows (calves). In tum, the farmers often try to kill the wild cats in order to protect their cattle!
Wouldn't it be great if we could study the situation and find a solution that suits both the farmers and the cheetahs? This is what we did with our research. We tracked the cheetah's behavior. We noticed that the cheetahs did not move their area to go after the calves. We thought that if the farmers kept their groups of cows with calves in certain areas, and not in others, they could avoid cheetah attacks. The farmers took our advice. They then compared the number of calves killed by cheetahs before and after these changes. So, did our advice work? Yes! The farmers observed a significant reduction in calves killed by cheetahs. This could prevent farmers from losing their valuable livestock and stop them from trying to kill the cheetahs.
Looking for solutions based on animal behavior could work for other species too. Can you think of any human-wildlife conflicts in your area? And do you think they could be solved without the animals being harmed or killed?
The word "cattle" in paragraph 1 is closest in meaning to.....

Options:
A) herd
B) life
C) farm
D) crops
17.solution:
کشاورزان چگونه از حملات یوزیلنگ اجتناب کردند؟
گزینهٔ ۱: آن ها گوساله ها را از گاوها جدا کردند.
گزینهٔ ۲: آن ها به یوزپلنگ ها اجازه دادند تعداد کمی از گوساله ها را بکشند و بخورند.
گزینهٔ ۳: آن ها توصیهٔ محققین را دنبال کردند.
گزینهٔ ۴: آن ها خانه هایشان را به مکان هایی به دور از یوزپلنگ ها بردند.
----------

18.question: What was the purpose of the study described in paragraph 2?

options.1: Discovering the reason why the farmers killed the cheetahs
options.2: Finding a way to help prevent both calves and cheetahs from being killed
options.3: Understanding how to make the cheetahs change the area where they lived
options.4: Explaining why both farmers and cheetahe could not understand and respect each other

18.full_text:
Passage 1:Sometimes humans and animals come into conflict with each other. This can threaten people's livelihoods and also threaten the animals' lives. In central Namibia, farmers have a problem with cheetahs. The cheetahs prey on the baby cows (calves). In tum, the farmers often try to kill the wild cats in order to protect their cattle!
Wouldn't it be great if we could study the situation and find a solution that suits both the farmers and the cheetahs? This is what we did with our research. We tracked the cheetah's behavior. We noticed that the cheetahs did not move their area to go after the calves. We thought that if the farmers kept their groups of cows with calves in certain areas, and not in others, they could avoid cheetah attacks. The farmers took our advice. They then compared the number of calves killed by cheetahs before and after these changes. So, did our advice work? Yes! The farmers observed a significant reduction in calves killed by cheetahs. This could prevent farmers from losing their valuable livestock and stop them from trying to kill the cheetahs.
Looking for solutions based on animal behavior could work for other species too. Can you think of any human-wildlife conflicts in your area? And do you think they could be solved without the animals being harmed or killed?
What was the purpose of the study described in paragraph 2?

Options:
A) Discovering the reason why the farmers killed the cheetahs
B) Finding a way to help prevent both calves and cheetahs from being killed
C) Understanding how to make the cheetahs change the area where they lived
D) Explaining why both farmers and cheetahe could not understand and respect each other
18.solution:
عملکرد پاراگراف آخر متن این است که ما را تشویق به یافتن راه حل هایی برای درگیری های انسان و حیات وحش کند تا حیوانات را به خطر
نیندازد.
۱) ما را وادار کند تا در مورد محیط زیست خود بدون نیاز به در نظر گرفتن حیوانات آن فکر کنیم
۲) ما را تشویق به یافتن راه حل هایی برای درگیری های انسان و حیات وحش کند تا حیوانات را به خطر نیندازد
۳) اشاره کند که ما نمی توانیم حیوانات را بدون مطالعهٔ رفتار آن ها با سایر گونه ها درک کنیم
۴) پیشنهاد کند که مطالعات بیشتری در مورد نقشی که رفتار حیوانات در جامعه انسانی ایفا می کند مورد نیاز است
" ترجمهٔ درک مطلب ۲:
دِیو فارو یک کانادایی است که به خاطر داشتن بهترین حافظه در کتاب رکوردهای جهانی گینس ظاهر شده است. دِیو وقتی دانش آموز
بود، برخلاف کشمکش ها با موضوعاتی مانند خواندن و نوشتن، راه هایی برای بهبود حافظهٔ خود پیدا کرد تا بتواند در مدرسه خوب عمل کند.
او در سال ۲۰۰۸ با به خاطر سپردن ترتیب ۵۹ دسته کارت بازی در دو روز، رکورد جهانی را به نام خود ثبت کرد. مغز او چگونه همهٔ این
اطلاعات را ذخیره می کرد؟ به گفتهٔ دِیو، مغز هر کسی می تواند این کار را انجام دهد، اما این کار به درک نحوهٔ عملکرد حافظه کمک می کند.
حافظهٔ کوتاه مدت شما فقط می تواند اطلاعات را از ۱۵ ثانیه تا چند دقیقه نگه دارد. علاوه براین، حافظهٔ کوتاه مدت تنها می تواند حدود
هفت چیز را در یک زمان نگه دارد. قهرمانان حافظه مانند دِیو باید لیست هایی طولانی از اطلاعات را در یک زمان در حافظهٔ کوتاه مدت خود
نگه دارند. آن ها برای این کار به ترفندهای مختلفی تکیه می کنند.
یک ترفند این است که به حرف اول هر کلمه ای که می خواهید حفظ کنید، نگاه کنید. سپس کلمه، عبارت یا جملهٔ خود را با استفاده از
تمام آن حروف ایجاد کنید. این "acronym" نامیده می شود. به عنوان مثال، اگر می خواهید تمام رنگ های رنگین کمان را به خاطر بسپارید،
سعی کنید نام Roy G. Biv. را به خاطر بسپارید. هر حرف در این نام خیالی با حرف اول یک رنگ مطابقت دارد.

19.question: Cloze Test (E):
19.full_text:
The human brain is very mysterious. Many questions about the brain have.............. (A). For example, why do we need to sleep or why do we dream?................. (B) lot about the brain that we still do not understand. Believe it or not, people used to think of the brain as useless stuffing......... (C), we now know the brain is our control center. The surface of the brain is called the cerebral cortex. It is the part of the brain that makes us intelligent, and it consists of four parts called lobes. The front lobe is .............. (D) of our thinking and feeling happens. The top lobe processes information which is coming from parts of our bodies, such as our skin and muscles. The side lobe plays an important................. (E) in hearing, speech and long-term memories while the back lobe processes images from our eyes.
Cloze Test (E):

Options:
A) role
B) value
C) tool
D) effect
19.solution:
بر اساس پاراگراف ۱ دِیو فارو در مدرسه در خواندن و نوشتن مشکل داشت.
۱) به این ایده رسید که کتاب رکوردهای جهانی گینس را بنویسد.
۲) وقتی دانشجو بود رکورد جهانی بهترین حافظه را ثبت کرد.
۳) در مدرسه در خواندن و نوشتن مشکل داشت.
۴) باور دارد که مغزی منحصر به فرد دارد.

20.question: How did the farmers avoid cheetah attacks?

options.2: They let cheetahs kill and eat a few of the calves.
options.4: They moved their houses to places far from cheetahs.

20.full_text:
Passage 1:Sometimes humans and animals come into conflict with each other. This can threaten people's livelihoods and also threaten the animals' lives. In central Namibia, farmers have a problem with cheetahs. The cheetahs prey on the baby cows (calves). In tum, the farmers often try to kill the wild cats in order to protect their cattle!
Wouldn't it be great if we could study the situation and find a solution that suits both the farmers and the cheetahs? This is what we did with our research. We tracked the cheetah's behavior. We noticed that the cheetahs did not move their area to go after the calves. We thought that if the farmers kept their groups of cows with calves in certain areas, and not in others, they could avoid cheetah attacks. The farmers took our advice. They then compared the number of calves killed by cheetahs before and after these changes. So, did our advice work? Yes! The farmers observed a significant reduction in calves killed by cheetahs. This could prevent farmers from losing their valuable livestock and stop them from trying to kill the cheetahs.
Looking for solutions based on animal behavior could work for other species too. Can you think of any human-wildlife conflicts in your area? And do you think they could be solved without the animals being harmed or killed?
How did the farmers avoid cheetah attacks?

Options:
A) They separated calves from eows.
B) They let cheetahs kill and eat a few of the calves.
C) They followed the researchers' recommendation.
D) They moved their houses to places far from cheetahs.
20.solution:
حافظهٔ کوتاه مدت می تواند تعداد محدودی از چیزها را برای مدت زمان محدود نگه دارد.
۱) فقط داده ها را تا ۱۵ ثانیه نگه دارد
۲) حجم عظیمی از اطلاعات را در یک زمان ذخیره کند
۳) تعداد محدودی از چیزها را برای مدت زمان محدود نگه دارد
۴) تنها هفت چیز را در یک زمان به حافظهٔ بلندمدت منتقل کند

21.question: The function of the last paragraph of the passage is to ...........

options.1: make us think about our environment without the need to consider its animals
options.2: encourage us to find solutions for human-wildlife conflicts that do not endanger animals.
options.3: point out that we cannot understand animals without studying their bchavior to other species.
options.4: suggest that more studies are needed about the role that animal behavior plays in human society.

21.full_text:
Passage 1:Sometimes humans and animals come into conflict with each other. This can threaten people's livelihoods and also threaten the animals' lives. In central Namibia, farmers have a problem with cheetahs. The cheetahs prey on the baby cows (calves). In tum, the farmers often try to kill the wild cats in order to protect their cattle!
Wouldn't it be great if we could study the situation and find a solution that suits both the farmers and the cheetahs? This is what we did with our research. We tracked the cheetah's behavior. We noticed that the cheetahs did not move their area to go after the calves. We thought that if the farmers kept their groups of cows with calves in certain areas, and not in others, they could avoid cheetah attacks. The farmers took our advice. They then compared the number of calves killed by cheetahs before and after these changes. So, did our advice work? Yes! The farmers observed a significant reduction in calves killed by cheetahs. This could prevent farmers from losing their valuable livestock and stop them from trying to kill the cheetahs.
Looking for solutions based on animal behavior could work for other species too. Can you think of any human-wildlife conflicts in your area? And do you think they could be solved without the animals being harmed or killed?
The function of the last paragraph of the passage is to ...........

Options:
A) make us think about our environment without the need to consider its animals
B) encourage us to find solutions for human-wildlife conflicts that do not endanger animals.
C) point out that we cannot understand animals without studying their bchavior to other species.
D) suggest that more studies are needed about the role that animal behavior plays in human society.
21.solution:
شی فرهنگی
بر اساس (کلمهٔ) مخفف ذکر شده در پاراگراف ۳، کدام یک از کلمه های زیر در بین رنگ های رنگین کمان نیست؟
۱) بنفش

22.question:
Passage 2:Dave Farrow is a Canadian who appears in the Guinness Book of World Records for having the greatest memory. As a student, despite his struggles with subjects like reading and writing, Dave found ways to improve his memory in order to do well in school. In 2008, he set a world record by memorizing the order of 59 decks of playing cards in two days. How did his brain store all of this information? According to Dave, anybody's brain can do it, but it helps to understand how memory works.
Your short-term memory can only hold information from 15 seconds to a few minutes. In addition, short-term memory can only hold about seven things at one time. Memory champions like Dave have to hold long lists of information in their short-term memory at one time. To do this, they rely on different tricks.
One trick is to look at the first letter of every word you want to memorize. Then, create your own word, phrase or sentence using all of those letters. This is called an acronym. For example, if you want to remember all the colors in a rainbow, try remembering the rame Roy G. Biv. Each letter in this fictional name matches the first letter of a color.
According to paragraph 1, Dave Farrow ...............

options.1: came up with the idea of writing the Guinness Book of World Records.
options.2: set a world record for the greatest memory when he was a student.
options.3: had difficulty with reading and writing at school.
options.4: believes that he has a unique brain.

22.full_text:
Passage 2:Dave Farrow is a Canadian who appears in the Guinness Book of World Records for having the greatest memory. As a student, despite his struggles with subjects like reading and writing, Dave found ways to improve his memory in order to do well in school. In 2008, he set a world record by memorizing the order of 59 decks of playing cards in two days. How did his brain store all of this information? According to Dave, anybody's brain can do it, but it helps to understand how memory works.
Your short-term memory can only hold information from 15 seconds to a few minutes. In addition, short-term memory can only hold about seven things at one time. Memory champions like Dave have to hold long lists of information in their short-term memory at one time. To do this, they rely on different tricks.
One trick is to look at the first letter of every word you want to memorize. Then, create your own word, phrase or sentence using all of those letters. This is called an acronym. For example, if you want to remember all the colors in a rainbow, try remembering the rame Roy G. Biv. Each letter in this fictional name matches the first letter of a color.
According to paragraph 1, Dave Farrow ...............

Options:
A) came up with the idea of writing the Guinness Book of World Records.
B) set a world record for the greatest memory when he was a student.
C) had difficulty with reading and writing at school.
D) believes that he has a unique brain.

23.question: The short-term memory can........................

options.1: only hold data for up to 15 seconds.
options.2: store huge amounts of information at one time.
options.3: hold a limited number of things for a limited length of time.
options.4: only transfer seven things to the long-term memory at one time.

23.full_text:
Passage 2:Dave Farrow is a Canadian who appears in the Guinness Book of World Records for having the greatest memory. As a student, despite his struggles with subjects like reading and writing, Dave found ways to improve his memory in order to do well in school. In 2008, he set a world record by memorizing the order of 59 decks of playing cards in two days. How did his brain store all of this information? According to Dave, anybody's brain can do it, but it helps to understand how memory works.
Your short-term memory can only hold information from 15 seconds to a few minutes. In addition, short-term memory can only hold about seven things at one time. Memory champions like Dave have to hold long lists of information in their short-term memory at one time. To do this, they rely on different tricks.
One trick is to look at the first letter of every word you want to memorize. Then, create your own word, phrase or sentence using all of those letters. This is called an acronym. For example, if you want to remember all the colors in a rainbow, try remembering the rame Roy G. Biv. Each letter in this fictional name matches the first letter of a color.
The short-term memory can........................

Options:
A) only hold data for up to 15 seconds.
B) store huge amounts of information at one time.
C) hold a limited number of things for a limited length of time.
D) only transfer seven things to the long-term memory at one time.

25.question: The paragraph following the last paragraph of this passage would most probably be about .......

options.1: the story of the fictional character Roy G. Biv.
options.2: the study skills that helped Dave Farrow train his memory.
options.3: reasons why the short-term memory easily throws information away.
